image.altText: A Hmong man and woman in wide-brimmed hats harvest from a row of kale with bushland behind them

props.synopsis: From a war-torn childhood in Laos, Dee Thao found her place in Tasmania as a market gardener. While she followed in her parents' footsteps, her children don't feel the same pull to continue the Hmong farming tradition.

title.children: Tasmanian Hmong children not carrying on family's farming tradition

image.altText: a replica tall ship sailing the River Derwent

props.synopsis: The Tasmanian replica tall ship, based on a 1800s ship pivotal to Hobart's colonial settlement, set sail with an all-female crew to celebrate this weekend's International Women's Day.

title.children: Pirates looted the Lady Nelson, her replica sails on, crewed by women

image.altText: A supermarket vacuum package of Huon Aquaculture roasted salmon

props.synopsis: A video released earlier this week of live and dead salmon being sealed into tubs has led to a leading animal welfare suspending its certification.

title.children: RSPCA suspends Huon Aquaculture certification over live fish disposal

image.altText: a fledgling orange bellied parrot held by two pairs of gloved hands

props.synopsis: Almost 30 of the critically endangered birds have been released from captivity, buoying expectations for a record-breaking winter migration this year.

title.children: 'Another record' expected as more captive-bred orange-bellied parrots released

image.altText: People holding protest signs about Tesla and Elon Musk outside a Tesla showroom.

props.synopsis: From protests at more than 50 Tesla showrooms across the US, and bumper stickers on Australian Teslas from embarrassed owners, to cheeky UK bus stop advertisements critical of boss Elon Musk — the criticism and condemnation appears to be gathering pace.

title.children: 'Dump Tesla': Protests target showrooms as sales slump hits stock

image.altText: A building part covered by flood water.

props.synopsis: Workers losing income in the aftermath of ex-Tropical Cyclone Alfred will be eligible for financial support. Here's what we know.

title.children: What and how much is the disaster recovery allowance?

image.altText: Dave Hughes

props.synopsis: Dave Hughes based his comedy career on the embarrassing moments of his life. Now he's ready to talk about the terrifying ones.

title.children: When Dave Hughes gave up alcohol, he swapped one problem for another

image.altText: The Duke of Orleans bay east of Esperance.

props.synopsis: Wharton Beach, east of Esperance, has been closed after the surfer was spotted in distress just after midday.

title.children: Surfer missing in WA's south-east after possible shark attack

image.altText: Men sit outside apartment building in rows in the sun.

props.synopsis: A dramatic and highly publicised operation by the Thai, Chinese and Myanmar authorities has led to the release of more than 7,000 people from online scam compounds in Myanmar.

title.children: Key takeaways from what people face in Myanmar after release from forced labour

image.altText: Taylan May leaves the Penrith Local Court in Penrith, wearing a dark suit

props.synopsis: Domestic violence charges that kept former Penrith Panthers player Taylan May out of the NRL have been dropped.

title.children: Charges against former Panthers player Taylan May dropped

image.altText: People lining up to to vote at polling place.

props.synopsis: The WA Nationals leader says the head of the WA Electoral Commission should be suspended amid a probe into a litany of failings at polling booths at the weekend.

title.children: WA Nationals leader calls for Electoral Commissioner suspension after voting fiasco

image.altText: Three cars surrounded by floodwater

props.synopsis: About 300 millimetres of rain fell within two hours in Hervey Bay on Sunday. The mayor says the town was unprepared because of a lack of warnings.

title.children: Hervey Bay mayor questions why weather bureau failed to warn of flooding

image.altText: A man in orange hi-vis clothing uses a chainsaw to lop branches off a tree fallen over a wet roadway.

props.synopsis: With hundreds of thousands of homes and businesses across southern Queensland and northern New South Wales without power, questions are inevitably turning to the strength of the electricity system.

title.children: 'No quick fix' to power outages in Qld, NSW as grid weakness laid bare

image.altText: A man in a beanie smiles at the camera, holding a large fish

props.synopsis: A court has heard the former NSW police officer described himself online as a "dirty paedo dad" and was prepared to pay for "underage fantasy and kink".

title.children: Former police officer requested porn with girls 'as young as possible'

props.synopsis: Around the clock coverage of news events as they break at home and abroad.

title.children: ABC News Channel live

image.altText: a boater looking out the window at sea

props.synopsis: The 34-year-old's body was found south of Eden after a three-day search by emergency services.

title.children: Body of missing Canberra rock fisher found on NSW far south coast

image.altText: A woman wearing a pink and orange singlet and shiny sunglasses running.

props.synopsis: Around 200 people have turned out in Canberra's south to take part in a solidarity run, after a female runner was allegedly grabbed by a man at Tuggeranong Hill last weekend.

title.children: 'She's not alone': Runners gather in solidarity after woman allegedly grabbed by man

image.altText: A guard tower in a correctional centre behind razor wire.

props.synopsis: Police are appealing for public assistance to help locate a 28-year-old man who escaped from Broken Hill Correctional Centre on Sunday.

title.children: Police hunt inmate who escaped outback correctional centre

image.altText: Peter Dutton scratches his head, dressed in a suit in front of a blue background.

props.synopsis: Peter Dutton, speaking while trapped by flooding at his Dickson home, has dismissed criticism of his decision to attend a fundraiser in Sydney as ex-Tropical Cyclone Alfred approached.

title.children: Peter Dutton defends 'diary commitments' in Sydney as cyclone approached

image.altText: Virat Kohli holds up Champions Trophy as teammates celebrate

props.synopsis: India's triumph at the 2025 Champions Trophy is the crowning moment for the world's best white ball team. Sadly, many won't see it that way, through no fault of the players themselves, writes Chris de Silva.

title.children: India's Champions Trophy win a tainted one despite team's dominance

image.altText: A man wearing a jacket and shirt speaks.

props.synopsis: Nationals leader Shane Love delivers a brutally frank post-mortem assessment in the wake of the conservatives' third successive election disaster at the hands of the state's dominant Labor party.

title.children: 'Like a drug addict': Nationals leader's startling post-mortem of WA election

image.altText: Three women watch a television at a group function

props.synopsis: While most seats have a clear winner, there are several that are going down to the wire as counting continues in the 2025 WA election.

title.children: These are the seats still on a knife edge as WA election vote counting continues

image.altText: A tall white and black building that says 'The Star' at the top, with tall palm trees in the foreground against blue sky

props.synopsis: Casino operator Star Entertainment is mulling a bid from US gaming giant Bally's, that would give it at least $250 million in funding, in exchange for a controlling stake in the group.

title.children: Star receives last-minute $250 million offer from US giant Bally's

image.altText: On an exhibition floor a man stands in front of a display of machine guns and rifles. A sign above says Thales.

props.synopsis: The national symbol for Australia's fallen soldiers has taken large sums of money from weapons makers, a move former staff call "inappropriate".

title.children: Critics slam weapons makers' war memorial funding as 'disgusting'

image.altText: A sketch of an Aboriginal woman

props.synopsis: A woman who killed a relative in a public park in Kununurra is sentenced to eight years and six months in prison.

title.children: Woman jailed for killing cousin in Kununurra park

image.altText: Yellow and blue for lease sign with red leased sticker over

props.synopsis: Rising rental prices in the West Australian town of Broome are forcing residents to take drastic measures and driving some out of town.

title.children: Broome residents forced to rethink as median rental price hits $1,000 a week

image.altText: Two Chinese dragons, one with a white head and another with a black, in front of a large crowd.

props.synopsis: High temperatures in Melbourne have failed to keep crowds away from the colour and celebrations of the annual Moomba Festival.

title.children: Record crowds flock to Moomba Festival

image.altText: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu at a press conference, in front of the Israeli and American flags.

props.synopsis: Israel's energy minister declared the country would cut off electricity supplies to Gaza, effective immediately, one week after all aid deliveries were halted.

title.children: Israel cuts off power supplies to Gaza ahead of ceasefire talks

image.altText: Trump rests his fingertips together at his desk in the Oval Office

props.synopsis: What's most important for Australia — and the entire Western world — is that America has fallen to anti-globalists, and they are carrying out a deep regime change in the style of an autocratic takeover.

title.children: America's future hinges on one important question

image.altText: Two boxers, one in a suit and the other a collard shirt, face off and talk to each other

props.synopsis: Big-hitting Australian boxer Brock Jarvis has traded vicious verbal blows with Keith Thurman to set the stage for a spicy super-welterweight showdown in Sydney.

title.children: Jarvis and Thurman trade verbal blows ahead of fight

image.altText: Men in Chinese military uniforms march

props.synopsis: Taiwan is a potential flashpoint for a war between China and the United States, which is the island's most important backer and biggest arms supplier.

title.children: Beijing warns it will tighten 'noose' around Taiwan over separatism

image.altText: Black and white image of a young man in a hat cuddling with a dog on a wicker chair

props.synopsis: The youngest son of Prince Robert of Luxembourg and Princess Julie of Nassau died in Paris from PolG mitochondrial disease, his father says.

title.children: Luxembourg's Prince Frederik dies at 22 from rare genetic condition

props.synopsis: Former central banker Mark Carney has won the race to become leader of Canada's ruling Liberal Party and will succeed Justin Trudeau as prime minister.

title.children: Trudeau successor as Canada PM revealed, takes swipe at Trump

image.altText: Tan France holds a bowtie, which is stretched stiff as if it has been pulled, at a Screen Actors Guild event.

props.synopsis: Tan France has gone from being the most wholesome member of the Fab Five to a menacing gangster (and full-time snack fanatic).

title.children: Queer Eye fashion expert Tan France pivots to gangster life
